      • getCsrfTokenName

        public String getCsrfTokenName()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        The name of CSRF token. Since the CSRF name is customizable, this method is used to obtain the actual token name being used in the form.
        Specified by:
        getCsrfTokenName in interface Form
        Returns:
        the name of the CSRF field.

      • setCsrfTokenName

        public DefaultForm setCsrfTokenName(String csrfTokenName)
        The name of CSRF token. This name is used to customize the token field name in the form.
        Returns:
        the name of the CSRF field.
        Since:
        1.0.RC5.2

      • getCsrfToken

        public String getCsrfToken()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Returns the CSRF token that must be included with the form during submission. If the CSRF token submitted with the form is missing, expired or has already been used, form submission will fail.
        Specified by:
        getCsrfToken in interface Form
        Returns:
        the the CSRF token that must be included with the form during submission.

      • getNext

        public String getNext()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Returns the next URI that the user should visit after successful form submission or an empty or null value, which indicates the controller processing form submission should execute suitable default behavior.

        If non-null/empty, the value is usually represented as a hidden form field since it is not relevant for users filling out forms. The hidden field just allows a stateless (sessionless) way of transferring state during form submissions.

        Specified by:
        getNext in interface Form
        Returns:
        the next URI that the user should visit after successful form submission or an empty or null value, which indicates the controller processing form submission should execute suitable default behavior.
